uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Class GeoRectangle

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.GeoShape
        |
        +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.GeoRectangle
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, IDReferenced, java.io.Serializable
public class GeoRectangle
extends GeoShape
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

A double presision rectangle.

It is usful for describing a GeoReferanced Rectangle Used by GeoPolygon to return a bounding box.

Version:
0.50, 17 Apr 1997
Author:
James Macgill
See Also:
Serialized Form

setBounds

public boolean setBounds(java.lang.String BBox)
Initialise the data in GeoRectangle based on a Open GIS BBox format, ie "xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax". If the string is incorrectly formatted, or has invalid data, then the data is set to GeoRectangle() and false is returned.
Parameters:
BBox - A string of the format "xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax".
Returns:
Boolean specifying TRUE if the geoRectangle was created successfully, false otherwise.

getPoints

public java.util.Vector getPoints()
Description copied from class: GeoShape
Gets a full list of all the points that make up this shape. For Polygons and rectangles this would be the vertecis, for circles it would be the center point.
Overrides:
getPoints in class GeoShape
Following copied from class: uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.GeoShape
Returns:
A Vector of GeoPoints for each point of this shape

remainder

public GeoRectangle[] remainder(GeoRectangle r)
returns the 4 rectangles that are left after r is removed from this rectangle. Some or all of the rectangles returned may be null. the side boxes are from base to top of this rectangle, the top/bottom boxes are from the edge to edge of the intersect
the return order is left,top,right,bottom
